questions.text: A clinical psychologist is discussing personality disorders with a group of medical students. Which of the following statements regarding personality disorders is NOT true?

options.label: A
options.text: The prevalence of personality disorders in the general population is approximately 10%.

options.label: B
options.text: Personality disorders typically have an onset in adolescence or early adulthood.

options.label: C
options.text: Individuals with personality disorders usually perceive their thoughts and behaviors as ego-syntonic.

options.label: D
options.text: SSRIs are considered the first-line treatment for personality disorders.

questions.correct_answer: D. SSRIs are considered the first-line treatment for personality disorders.
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) SSRIs are considered the first-line treatment for personality disorders.

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Option A. The prevalence of personality disorders in the general population is approximately 10%: This statement is generally considered true based on epidemiological studies , although prevalence rates can vary depending on the specific type of personality disorder and the assessment methods used.
  • • Option A. The prevalence of personality disorders in the general population is approximately 10%:
  • • statement
  • • considered true based on epidemiological studies
  • • Option B. Personality disorders typically have an onset in adolescence or early adulthood: This statement is true . Personality disorders usually begin in adolescence or early adulthood, as personality traits become more stable during these periods.
  • • Option B. Personality disorders typically have an onset in adolescence or early adulthood:
  • • true
  • • Option C. Individuals with personality disorders usually perceive their thoughts and behaviours as ego-syntonic: This statement is true . One of the characteristics of personality disorders is that individuals often view their maladaptive patterns of thinking and behavior as normal or justified (ego-syntonic), which can make them resistant to recognizing their condition or seeking treatment.
  • • Option C. Individuals with personality disorders usually perceive their thoughts and behaviours as ego-syntonic:
  • • true

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Personality disorders are characterized by persistent and maladaptive patterns of behavior, cognition, and inner experience. These disorders typically begin in adolescence or early adulthood and are often ego-syntonic , meaning individuals may not see their behavior as problematic. Psychotherapy, not SSRIs, is the cornerstone of treatment for personality disorders, although medications may be used to address specific symptoms or comorbid conditions.
  • ➤ Personality disorders are characterized by persistent and maladaptive patterns of behavior, cognition, and inner experience.
  • ➤ begin in adolescence or early adulthood
  • ➤ often ego-syntonic
  • ➤ individuals may not see their behavior as problematic.

questions.text: A 23-year-old medical student presents to the surgery emergency department after cutting her wrist with a blade. Educational Objective:

Another characteristic feature is the repetitive self-destructive acts such as the slashing of wrists, or overdosage of medications. The patients indulge in these behaviors to elicit help from others, to express their anger or just to numb themselves to the overwhelming painful feelings they have. questions.text: A 32-year-old man with a known history of Antisocial Personality Disorder (ASPD) is brought to the clinic by his brother. options.label: C

options.text: Diagnosed only in individuals above 30 years of age
